DataElement.preferredName: Patient International Breast Cancer Study Group Randomization Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a patient was randomized for a trial sponsored by the The International Breast Cancer Study Group (IBCSG), created as the 'Ludwig Breast Cancer Study Group' in 1977, is dedicated to innovative clinical research designed to improve the prognosis of women with breast cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient International Breast Cancer Study Group Randomization
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the randomization of a patient for a trial sponsored by the The International Breast Cancer Study Group (IBCSG), created as the 'Ludwig Breast Cancer Study Group' in 1977, is dedicated to innovative clinical research designed to improve the prognosis of women with breast cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Property.preferredName: International Breast Cancer Study Group Randomization
Property.preferredDefinition: The International Breast Cancer Study Group (IBCSG), created as the 'Ludwig Breast Cancer Study Group' in 1977, is dedicated to innovative clinical research designed to improve the prognosis of women with breast cancer. Patients and investigators from six continents: Europe, Australia/ New Zealand, Africa, Asia, and North and South America, cooperate by participating in extensive clinical trials in the Adjuvant breast cancer setting. IBCSG has been a pioneer in research into combined hormonal therapy and chemotherapy, timing and duration of Adjuvant Therapies, and Quality of Life of breast cancer patients. (from ibcsg.org):The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

Concepts.definition: A group dedicated to innovative clinical research designed to improve the prognosis of women with breast cancer. Patients and investigators from six continents: Europe, Australia/ New Zealand, Africa, Asia, and North and South America, cooperate by participating in extensive clinical trials in the Adjuvant breast cancer setting. IBCSG has been a pioneer in research into combined hormonal therapy and chemotherapy, timing and duration of Adjuvant Therapies, and Quality of Life of breast cancer patients. (from ibcsg.org)
The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
